Reviews.Title: “Charming and Welcoming Little Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: DottoressadiExeter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Apollo Hotel to explore the ancient sites and to re-visit old haunts. Having lived in Rome previously we were familiar with the area and it was just as we remembered it. The hotel was on a reasonably quiet street and is only a short walk to the ruins. We had a room on the fourth floor with a view out onto the street, at the end of which was the Colosseum! The rooms were really quite charming, with flocked wallpaper and comfy beds. Yes, the bins do get emptied quite early in the morning, but we only heard it because we had the windows open. The windows, when shut, were well double-glazed, meaning that there was not a lot of noise for a city centre location. The staff were lovely and very welcoming, arranging a taxi for the airport for our return home and very willing to offer recommendations for restaurants if you needed them. There were plenty of little grocery stores and shops on the street, so you were never short of a gelato or two. The mini bar in the hotel room was also very reasonably priced with room to put your own bits and bobs that you wanted to keep cool. Breakfast (served from 7am - 10am) offered a range of croissants, pastries, bread, cereal and the continental style selection of cheese and ham. By far the best part was the cappucinos prepared for you on request. In all, there is going to be something for everyone and the atmosphere of the breakfast room was really lovely on the sunny mornings. Not far down the street was the Forno de' Serpenti, a little bakery that offered a fantastic range of pastries, treats, bread and sandwiches and is absolutely worth a visit. Everything is paid for by weight, so it's really good value to grab a few things before venturing off into the city, particularly as you will pay a real premium for snacks in the area around the Forum and the Via del Corso. A small drinking water fountain can also be found on the street, so it's easy to fill up your water bottles. The Cavour metro stop was only a short walk away. We had an absolutely lovely stay. The only reason we could not give a full five star review is because we thought that the hotel could do with some new bath towels - a few of ours being quite extensively ripped when we came to use them - but this really should not over shadow just how wonderful this little hotel is for a stay in Rome. We would be very happy to return in future and, having stayed in several 4* hotels in the city, I would quite happily choose this hotel over them purely for the better value Hotel Apollo offers for a stay in the city. Grazie Mille Hotel Apollo!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant accommodation near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: SwimmingSeas
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a better place to stay at in Rome. This hotel was extremely confortable, elegant in a over-the-top-yet-still-acceptable way, spotlessly clean, served by helpful, attentive staff and superbly located in a an area that wasn’t too busy and was still close to many areas of interest. The room was spacious and had a good minibar in a fridge large enough to allow for some of our own food/drinks too. The bathroom was large and bright, with thin, but numerous and fresh white towels and a selection of cosmetics. The staff were welcoming when we got there, offered us a map of the city upon arrival, a plug adaptor when asked for, promptly called taxies for us whenever needed. The breakfast room on the upper terrace must be wonderful in the warmer seasons. It was quite friendly, if a bit cold, now too. The food on offer was varied and good, if a bit biased towards the sweet things. They offered freshly made cappuccinos or espressos as well. Internet cards were available from the reception for 5 euro for 3 hours. We would certainly return to this hotel and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I booked”
Reviews.Author: where299
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid 3 months in advance the 1 bedroom apartment we were a party of 2 ladies 2 teenagers (14) boy and girl. We liked the look of it on the net we wanted a kitchen so we could cook and make a cuppa. On arrival at 9.30pm we were told could not have the apartment person in it is still there was sick had seen a doctor was told he could not b moved, we said if he is that sick he should b in a hospital. We were put into 2 separate rooms 2 single beds in each no cooking facilities not even a kettle. We then had to pay for every meal we had. When standing outside the next morning we saw a husband and wife 2 small children go through the entry to the apartment we booked it is the separate gated area next to the hotel if you looking at it on the site. I recieved no phone call regarding the change had to stay otherwise would have blown my money. Will never stay at that hotel again and in regards to agoda will not use them again either.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Shrimpeses
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. A small family owned hotel and it showed. We were very well looked after by all staff during our Roman visit, breakfast was a varied substanial continental buffet. The rooms were clean and well appointed in an older style which was very elegant in truth. This hotel is always busy and its not difficult to see why.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, family run and very convenient to sights”
Reviews.Author: NY-LA-SF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the suggestion of Elizabeth Minchilli and her Eat Rome app. (Get it if you're going -- best $3 you'll spend.) We were very happy with the hotel and the location. We dropped off our bags after a long flight from LA, cleaned up and within 10 minutes we were looking at the Spanish Steps. (Albeit from behind a wall of other tourists.) Oh and before we left the hotel, we leaned out the window to take in the street scene and were blown away to see the Collosseum right there to our left. It's nearly impossible to get away form tourists in Rome, but the Apollo is in a neighborhood, so at least you have a blend of locals and tourists in the streets. We found it very convenient to public transportation for sights that were too far to walk to (Vatican, etc.) Would stay again in a heartbeat. Also a pretty reasonable price for a large city. I overslept the breakfast the whole time we were there, but my partner was very happy with it. Again, you're in Rome. Have a little something at the hotel and then go out and eat your way across the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & friendly family operated hotel in awesome historical center of Roma”
Reviews.Author: Faccia_Pietra
Reviews.Content: Third time staying at this quaint family owned and operated hotel - and just as enjoyable a stay as previous visits! Located in centro storico Roma within view of the mighty Roman coloseum. There are plenty of little restaurants, coffee shops, and tiny grocery stores in the vicinity. A tasty buffet breakfast is served each morning in the rooftop terrace dining room - including custom made delicious cappucini! :) Many, many thanks to the delightful family and staff of Hotel Apollo. We appreciate all your kind care & thoughtfulness. We look forward to our next trip to Rome and again staying at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location !”
Reviews.Author: Pam73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Apollo was an amazing find ! The location cant get any better, the colosseum being a short walk from the hotel. What is also extremely convenient is that the Metro station Cavour is just a 5 min walk so we could explore Rome extensively by using the train. The Trevi fountain as well as Campo di Fiori markets are also at a walkable distance. The rooms and bathrooms are modern and well equipped and we loved the breakfast on the rooftop terrace especially the freshly made coffee and hot croissants.The only things we were not too happy about were that the bathrooms expecially the shower box is very small and secondly there were mosquitos in the room but they didnt have and couldnt provide any mosquito repellants in the room. Inspite of these minor defects we would still stay here on our next visit to Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Rick B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their apartments in front of Cavour station, the environment was superb, we walked and enjoyed the cafes, restaurants and shops around the hotel. So close to the colleseum that was unreal. You can't afford not to stay here, specially if traveling with kids as the unit will fit easily 5 person (we are 4) the staf really helpful and the rooms impeccable clean. It maximized our experience in Rome, I'm looking forward to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Iainbr
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant family run hotel. The rooms were small but clean and delightfully Italian Mama in their decor. It was a short walk to the Colosseum and about 15 to 20 minutes to The Pantheon. The breakfast on roof terrace was a great way to start a Roman day. Great stay fantastic service and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MMinUSA
Reviews.Content: The neat thing about this hotel is that it does actually look exactly like the online pictures, no surprises. It was clean and the front desk recommended some nice restaurants and gave us a wonderful map. Now, just FYI kind of things - the shower is SMALL. It looks exactly like the picture, but it is small. The towels are huge, but thin (probably so they fit into the shower with you... ). Our room was on the front of the hotel, and we could see the Coloseum when we looked to the left. We had noise reduction shutters, which, while it wasn't terribly noisy, they definitely made a difference. It is a great central location, we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellento!!”
Reviews.Author: Chodoboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel suprised us in so many ways. The family were unbelievably friendly, their English was perfect (they helped me with my broken Italian), the location was excellent (5mins walk from the Colosseum, 15min from from the centre of town), breakfast was very good and on the top balcony, the room was refurbished and the bathrooms exceptional by Rome standards! The WiFi was 5 Euro for 3 hours but the connection was fast and consistent. The local area had some really good restraunts, expecially as you turn right out of the hotel. I would recomend this place to anyone looking to stay in Rome. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small and clean”
Reviews.Author: Mericauchi
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and looked refurbished. Staff were very helpful with directions and maps. Reception was 24 hours which was good as we were going in and out at all hours and there was always some one there. The hotel was about 10 mins walk from the main part of town. Along the way were lots of stores, coffee shops restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sucam
Reviews.Content: Great location...walking distance from Coloseum. The small pizza place next door....is a must place to take out....Night staff did not speak English...but day staff did. They arranged a cab for us...who was there ahead of time....Breakfast was heavenly....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Havana-sun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Apollo for 4 nights. The location is great. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful. The night person did speak good English, but the day staff (I assume the owners) did not. We do speak Spanish so that was helpful. Would recommend this hotel. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_Nunez
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of the location. It was great. We did not stayed at the hotel itself but in an apartment some corners away. It was big, clean and had all that we were looking for. Lots of restaurants, a metro stop in front (Cavour) and the colisseum just some minutes away. When going back to Rome for sure we will stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Tinzarno
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel. It's good value for money, clean, breakfast was delicious with plenty of choices and the view of the Colosseum from our window was amazing. The hotel has perfect location for the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum and the Metro station. There is also a bus route which runs along the top of the street. There's lots of bars and restaurants in the area which are open late and have a chilled atmosphere. The area is very pretty with a fountain a few doors down. There are also various shops close. The only things i would change or improve about the hotel is that the air con could be stronger, the TV should have international channels and not freeze for 10 mins every time you flick and the breakfast terrace should be open during the day/ evening. These are trivial though and it didn't spoil my holiday one bit. The owners and staff are kind and helpful, the hotel entrance is tasteful and the location is perfect. I would stay again and definitely recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for seeing all there is to see in Rome. You have easy access to the bus system which can take you anywhere, and there are many nice restaurants located with easy walking distance. I recommend going to one of the tourist centers and purchasing your museum tickets and bus pass. You can see the Coliseum from the front of the hotel. The morning breakfast is adequate, but get there early or they will be out of food. We chose this hotel because of its location and price (we were touring europe with our teenagers). If you only need a good place to sleep while seeing the sights then this is your hotel. But, if you are looking for a romantic place to stay...this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close to Coloseum”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoMel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my (older) parents and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were helpful with restaurant recommendations, getting an airport taxi, and even sent us to a great gelato store! The rooms were very clean, if small. The breakfast area is up on the roof in a charming, plant-filled area with a view and the staff were happy to make espresso drinks as you wished. I could have stayed up there for hours! Breakfast was the usual European fare and fresh. The Coloseum was within walking distance, but we used the metro or taxis to visit other sites. I would happily stay at the Apollo again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, breakfast terrace and service.”
Reviews.Author: Scigal1
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 couples and 1 teenager) stayed at Hotel Apollo in July 2011. We were able to walk almost anywhere in Rome from the hotel and found the desk helpful. The breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace and was the usual assortment of cold cuts, cheeses, pastries, cereals etc. The owner's son works there and is most willing to make you a fresh cappucino! Our only problem was that we were given a suite of 2 rooms in the adjoining building and so required 4 keys to enter and leave our rooms. Anything in the main building (breakfast, inquiries, etc.) required the 4 locks up and the 4 locks down! The rooms however were lovely, large and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “'We live like real Romans!'”
Reviews.Author: Larisa_F
Reviews.Content: Family run hotel- hospitable, helpfully, responsive family! We stayed at onebedroom apartment at 4th floor with private terrace. Quiet, neat, authentic wood beams and fabric-covered walls. Bedroom is very quiet with window to yard. Bathroom is with 2 basins (very comfortable for family), shower with different kind of massage streams, good shower/hair gel and other amenities. Towels are thick, but they are different size, in sufficient supply and changed every day, that it was no trouble in using them. A living-room has glass table, 4 chairs, two large convertible armchairs, small kitchen (sink, kitchen cupboard,electric stove) closing as wardrobe. Breakfast was not too extensive, but all was fresh and tasty with different cake every day and cappuccino- more then enough! We traveled with child, so destination to main attractions was very comfortable. About 5 minutes to Colosseo,Foro di Traianei, 7 min to Piazza Venezia, 15 min to Trevi, 20 min to Spagna, 1 min to via Nationale- the best location! There are good gastronomy, ice-cream, food shops on the way to Colosseo (at via Serpenti). Definitely Beautiful place to stay in Rome! All our staying we were provided information and advices about what to see and how to get there. Also we liked warm and friendly atmosphere at hotel. The most pleasure for me was my son saying: 'We live like real Romans!'

Reviews.Title: “A wondeful hotel in the heart of acient Rome”
Reviews.Author: wa3yri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed 6 days here and enjoyed the hotel and the family that runs it. The included breakfast on the roof terrace was a wonderful way to start the day. Massimo's cappuccinos were the best we've ever had. The entire staff was very helpful, friendly and helped make our Rome experience excellent. The room was very clean, nicely apportioned and large enough to be comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a great Rome experience. Everything is in walking distance (most under a mile) and the hotel staff helps with maps and directions. Bob&Kathy-NJ-USA

Reviews.Title: “What we needed”
Reviews.Author: ATL_FamilyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The other reviews cover it. Location, location, location. Only negative, mentioned by others, is the weak AC and expensive Internet. 5 euro for 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Why so hightly rated? Is it relative to other 3-star Rome hotels?”
Reviews.Author: psychcal
Reviews.Content: NOTE: please take into account this was our first time in Rome and that we went on to stay in much nicer 3-star hotels in Florence and Venice. We (my two teenage kids and I) stayed at the Apollo hotel for 3 nights at the end of June. We chose the Apollo based on TA reviews, location, and relative price (what we assumed we had to pay for a 3-star Rome hotel in June). The good: The Apollo is close to the train station (15 minute walk) and the Colosseum (5 minute walk). It's located on a side street off of Via Cavour and Vai Nazionale, and is a short walk from the Forum. Pantheon, and Trastevere. The hotel itself is well maintained, and provides a nice continental breakfast in a fairly large sitting area on the top floor. The not so good: Our triple room was expensive, over $300 a night for a room that was (1) small (about 180 square feet) and somewhat darkly lit (2) poorly air conditioned (the air conditioning turned itself off every night such that you woke up sweltering), (3) did not have free wi-fi (we ended up paying 30 euros for 6 tickets that gave us 3 hours internet access per ticket). (4) had a staff that was neither very fluent in Englich nor very friendly (they never asked us how they could help in our stay) (5) had a very small bathroom (30 square feet) (6) had a small 22" flat screen TV Again, I'm basing my lukewarm review on the fact that we went on to stay in much nicer, cheaper hotels in Florence and Venice. If the Apollo is typical for this price for a 3-star hotel in Rome, take that into account while reading this review. All I know is that if I were to return to Rome, I'd look at hotels at other parts of the city, perhaps closer to the Spanish steps, in hopes of getting more hotel for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancyaustinpo
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with 4 other family members and needed 1 triple room & 1 double room. I was having a hard time finding a good hotel in the lower price range some of my family wanted to spend. (My sister prefers to stay in only 4 or 5 star hotels in Europe but my parents couldn't afford that). I tried to find a hotel that was as centrally-located as possible (good walking distance to most everything) but also reasonably-priced. Hotel Apollo fit all my criteria and, because of all the great reviews on TripAdviser, I booked this hotel. I was NOT disappointed!! This was/is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at in Europe. The triple room I stayed in was beautiful (my niece took pictures of the beautiful fabric-covered walls). The bathroom was immaculately cleaned every day (floors even mopped!). Just be aware, the maids take their work seriously and prefer you not come back to the room while they are cleaning and they don't like to stop! The breakfast every morning was plentiful (but I wouldn't consider it an "American breakfest" - no hot items). But there was plenty to eat with fresh fruit, many different breads/rolls, cereal, salami & cheese, yogurt and wonderful Cappacinno made fresh to order!! The location was perfect! It is in the Monti District and we felt we were living there, not vacationing! It's a close walk to the Colosseum. There were very few tourists in the neighborhood so it wasn't crowded. The restaurants were all great & not touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Apollo Hotel Apartment”
Reviews.Author: scubatricia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the apartment that the Apollo Hotel owns. It was brand new and beautifully furnished. What a treasure! Hidden Gem!! The owner of Apollo was so helpful in giving us directions, names of restaurants, attractions etc. He made our stay in Rome a wonderful experience. We ate breakfast ( chocolate crossants and coffee/tea and freshly squeezed orange juice) at the a cafe round the corner each morning----Labottegadelcaffe. Its worth going to. We knew it was good when all the locals ate there. Fyi...I rarely write reviews but the Apollo hotel apartment is worth writing a review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast and good location”
Reviews.Author: conFuSed79
Reviews.Content: Situated very close to Old Rome and Colloseum, Apollo Hotel is a good place to stay if you're doing a weekend city break. The rooftop breakfast is quite refreshing in the morning (could do with more hot food like eggs) and the rooms are adequate (although the decor could do with a bit of an update). Service was personable as the hotel is run by a family. Also very close to a gelato place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Dgrossma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their apartments and they were amazing. Great location and price. Would stay there if I went back to Rome. The staff is very friendly especially the owner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mh24
Reviews.Content: I was only able to stay in Rome for a day and a half and this hotel was the perfect location for a quick trip. It was easily within walking distance to all major sites. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean and fairly large. The price was a little high for one night, but worth it for the central location. Great hotel for a stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: bethney80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the colesseum. The view is just as the picture here shows. When we checked in we found the hotel staff didn't speak much english (just 1 younger gentleman did, and he was very helpful. He is usually at the desk in the evenings). This is a family run hotel and it looked like they live right on site. The towels were crazy thin...like drying with a table cloth. Those are the only 2 negative things I can say. The rooms were, by european standards, a decent size. It was close to the things we wanted to see most. There was in internet cafe just a few doors down as well as several small cafes. We tried several and they were all good. Just don't bother making a special request. I did. I didn't get the "away from the main street" room I asked for. Though it was nice, being a small hotel, there were only 5 rooms per floor. Almost no hallway noise. Overall we were happy with the Hotel Apollo Roma and would stay there again if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay and would choose again”
Reviews.Author: RosieRed19
Reviews.Content: Found this place on tripadvisor and it's just as described. It's very close to the Forum, we could see it in the distance from our window. It's located in a safe area on a narrow street within walking distance to most of the major historical sites you'll want to see if you're on your first trip to Rome, there for a short time or both. Termini is a walkable distance away, we got off route because of having to avoid a very large public protest crowd and walked all around, street signs are not on every corner and sometimes names change or don't appear on the map. Later that pm after we'd had time to recharge, we couldn't believe how much out of way we'd acutally wallked I don't speak any Italian and the few people we met at the hotel didn't speak English. We were fortunate to meet up with the evening deskclerk who was able to offer suggestions and help in our language. .The language barrier generally was not an issue, everyone was polite and pleasant. There's an new 2 person + luggage lift. Don't expect a large room however it was clean, comfortable and adaquate for our 2 night stay pre- cruising. Speaking of cruising, the Port is approx 1-1/2 hr drive from Rome. I must mention a very effecient English speaking hotel desk employee kindly arranged for a taxi to pick us up @ the hotel and drive us to the Port, ( it was a eye-opening journey, the driver drove like a race-car driver, the car was a lovelynew BMW & he had us there in 45 min. The desk employee compared a Taxi fare to taking the train considering train fares & taxi's to from station it was only a few more $$. The convenience and excitment couldn't have been topped. Getting back to the room, the bathroom seemed relatively newer, it's white tile, bright & clean. Don't be expecting the fluffy terrycloth towels or an abundance of soaps as we've grown used in N.A., however we had what we needed and it was perfect. It has european power so bring along a converter. The roof-top breafast dining area is pleasant and you'll find enough good food and beverages to get you started on your day. They were kind enough to let us in before opening on the morning of our departure and this was appreciated. Our helpful deskclerk, in addition to arranging our transfer, also advised and arranged our St Peters & Vatican tour which we never thought we'd be able to do. We'd looked independently and couldn't find anything matching our times. So all in all we crammed a great deal into our 2 days in Rome thanks his generous time in assisting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, very friendly family-run hotel - had wonderful visit!!”
Reviews.Author: Faccia_Pietra
Reviews.Content: We stayed several days at this very nice hotel located just a few minutes walk from the Colosseum. The hotel is family-run and each day we were greeted warmly by various of the family members and made to feel very welcome. All of the staff were very helpful with any questions we were always treated very politely. Our room was located on the third floor at the front of the building. The room had a large, clean bathroom. The room was clean, comfortable, and very quiet - the only noise was nightly trash collection. The area that the hotel is in is clean and it is quiet at night. We walked around and always felt safe. Breakfast was served at the quaint rooftop terrace with a personally made delicious cup of cappucino. Breakfast buffet consisted of juices, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, sweet rolls, cakes, breads, butter, jams, ham and cheese. The breakfast was tasty and filling and the atmosphere relaxing and not rushed - a great way to tool up for a full-speed-ahead day touring Rome. This hotel is very well located within walking distances to many of the central historical areas of the city - recommend good sturdy walking shoes. There is a very nice family-run small restaurant just a few doors from the hotel called "The DoDo". We enjoyed dinner there several nights. The restaurant is sparkling clean and tastefully decorated with polite staff, very tasty food, and fantastic tiramasu. In all, we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at The Apollo Hotel and we would highly recommend this charming hotel to friends and family. We definitely hope to return to the Apollo again! Many, many thanks and best wishes to dear Daniella - and her entire family - they all made our visit to Rome very special!! Mille grazie!!

Reviews.Title: “nice family run small hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Before staying at the hotel, was a little concerned about the location and age of the rooms based on photos seen here and on their site. Was still concerned when we pulled up to the hotel. We had booked the triple room, but when we arrived, we were in room 502 or 504 in the adjoining building, which was a huge double with a king bed, couch and very large bath. Looked a lot nicer than the photos of the triple we had seen, so we were happy. It looked like it had been recently renovated (there was still plastic on one of the chair cushions). The bath had only a shower stall (looked new) but that was fine with us; though it's a bit of a tight fit, and neither of us is a large person. There was a built in ledge stool in the shower, which made it yet harder to move around in the shower. We had read about the towels - not plush terry, but thin like large dishtowels, but nevertheless quite absorbent. The breakfast buffet is a nice option, nice way to start a long day of touristing about - frees you up from having to find a place to go, good selection, cappuccinos are great. The family that owns/runs this hotel is extremely nice and seem to truly care that their guests enjoy their stay. The location is very convenient, the neighborhood is okay. Seems perfectly safe, with some cute restaurants and shops along the street, but not upscale by any means. On the second part of our trip we returned to Rome and stayed at another hotel near the Borghese Gardens and Spanish Steps, which is a nicer area and the hotel was more upscale. That room was also very nice, though smaller and notably more expensive and not as convenient to the Metro. So think it depends on what you will be doing during your trip - if first time/visiting a lot of tourist sites, the Apollo is a great option - inexpensive, walking distance to many sites, near 2 metro stops to get to other areas easily, clean, nice ownership. And, as another viewer kindly pointed out - a block or two away from a good gelato shop!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: lizzer_a
Reviews.Content: We only had one day and one night in Rome, and selecting the right hotel for the right value was daunting. The Hotel Apollo Roma is clean and well-appointed and has a perfect location for exploring the historic center of Rome. We walked everywhere and back. We had no problems navigating, the staff was very helpful and friendly (we spoke no Italian and they spoke some limited English), there was plenty to eat and drink nearby, and we could see the Coliseum from our window (okay, we had to lean out the window, but still!). We would definitely return (we promised Adriano we would) and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: norwooda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in the Apollo Hotel and now understand why there are virtually no negative reviews of the hotel. A nice breakfast is included on the hotel's roof, the staff is friendly and very helpful, and it is so close to the Colosseum (you can see it from the front steps of the hotel). The room was a good size for Europe and a comfortable bed. The decor was very nice and unexpected for not being a very expensive hotel. The tv was tiny, but I was only interested in the tv before bed so it didn't matter much. I was very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Spuzzum007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days while visiting Rome on our Honeymoon and we loved every minute of it. The staff was super helpful (even with the fun language barrier in some cases), the location can't be beat - seriously, it's amazing, and the breakfast was perfect. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Great Location, Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: TCKNIGHT
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Rome and our last city we hit on our mini-European tour. We chose this hotel based off the TripAdvisor reviews and I'm so glad we did too because our stay was everything we needed it to be! We stayed for 4 nights in the beginning of July 2010. We just needed a clean and central place to stay for our short time in Rome. We loved that you could just walk outside the front doors and the Colloseum was right there - beautiful! Check-in: We pre-paid our hotel stay through Expedia and check-in was quick and the staff were very friendly. The room: CLEAN! I work at a non-profit that has an Emergency Shelter so I'm very aware and on alert for bed bugs (a current epidemic in the states), and I'm very happy to say that there were no bugs of any sort in my room. The room was actually a lot bigger than expected considering European standards. It was very clean and the bathroom worked for two of us. We didn't need anything extravagent, just a clean place to lay our tired bums after days of sightseeing and for much-needed siestas! So the room definitely met our needs. The complimentary breakfast: OMG :) Much better than anything you'd find at a comparable hotel in the states. The breakfast included fresh deli meats, sweet breads, fresh fruit of a wide variety, a couple of juice and cereal choices, and best of all, any espresso-made drink your heart desired! We enjoyed mochas and cappucino's every morning. AND the breakfast buffet is located at the top of the building with a charming outdoor patio to cool off in the warm summer mornings we had there. Since this was my first visit to Europe, I'm not sure if this type of breakfast spread is the norm, but we had stayed in a couple cities in the suburbs of London, in Paris, in Venice, and in Lake Como...and only at this hotel and the Hotel Villa Marie (in Lake Como) did we have such a nice breakfast spread. Location: I found the location to be really good considering the price of the hotel. We were just a few blocks from the train station, from the Colloseum, the Trevi Fountain, and from the Piazza Navona. One night it only took us 30 mins to walk across the river to the Trastevere neighborhood. Also nearby were great little restaurants and a small wine/mini-mart-style shop (where we were able to pick up beer, wine, and snacks). Overall: I think this hotel is a great bargain for the quality and location. Also, our last day in Rome, our flight wasn't until 8pm at night, so the hotel kindly kept our luggage all day after check-out so we could sightsee without lugging everything around with us. So, would I stay here again? Definitely! It's a bargain and the location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location with Lovely Mom & Pop Appeal”
Reviews.Author: jaki_85
Reviews.Content: You know those scenes in movies where the main star travels afar and looks out their window and is taken back by the view? That's how I felt when I checked at hotel apollo. I stuck my head out the window and was amazed at the view of the Colosseum, which is only 4-5 blocks away . The decor was decidedly Victorian, but room and bathroom were clean. Breakfast (free) is served on the roof top terrace. This includes all kinds of juices and tea, jams, nutella, pate, croissants, and delicious meats. The dining area had a lovely cozy ambiance. The owners are an elderly couple with their sons and extended family, and you can tell that invest great care in their service. While they may not have the amenities of your typical chain hotel..i.e. gym, lounge, etc, the lovely service, kind people, and homey feel made up for it. There is a little plaza nearby with dining options and a fountain where people sit and drink wine in the evening. There's also an American Apparel store on the same street, just a random observation. You can't get closer to the heart of Rome than this little hotel. Trevi fountain and Spanish steps, Coloseum, the Forum are all within walking distance. You can subway to the Vatican, or if you're adventurous, walking is also an option. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: melacruiser
Reviews.Content: The apollo hotel was everything and more then expected. The location is excellent - close to all major attractions - we walked everywhere. The breakfast buffee on the rooftop was an excellent way to begin the day, with great variety and smiling friendly service. The hotel is secure with the front desk always occupied, and it is small enough for the staff to know you and "watch out for you". Thank you to the Apollo Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star hotel thats well priced and in easy location to the train and tram”
Reviews.Author: KiwiR0b
Reviews.Content: We stepped off the train and walked past all the taxi drivers and touts and 3 minutes later we were in the reception of the Apollo Hotel. The receptionist was fluent in English and explained all the functions of the hotel in a clear and concise manner. We found breakfast to be a typical Continental style with bread , ham , eggs and jam . The coffee machine was excellent and we had plenty of time to sit and watch those around us eat and admire the views. The location was handy for the trams and the subway and we also walked to the Coloseum from the hotel and it was a pleasant 20 minute walk. For a 3 star hotel it was a pleasant experience and we will repeat again when next in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that`s where the plusses stop”
Reviews.Author: familynorthwestUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room next door based on review from one of the fellow trip advisors. The location is ideal for most tourist attractions. Breakfast was good. We emailed the hotel to get confirmation that there were indeed two rooms and we had the reply back which did not specifically say two rooms but did not refute a very straight question either. The family room in next door building does have two rooms but are rented/charged separately. Despite prior agreement we had to pay totally extra for the the additional room. The apartment is in 3rd floor of adjacent narrow residential building and can get lift from first floor and will have to come down one flight of stairs to get into the room! The stairs are remarkably narrow with acute bend and certainly not easy to manipulate suitcases or prams around. Shower is absolutely terrible remember to keep it running for about 15 minutes to get warm water from this tacky looking shower. Both bedside table lamps in our rooms were faulty. What`s the point of a large room where the only place you can sit is your bed! There is an apparent bar which is does not function (speacifically asked at the reception), probably it is there just to dodge the star raters. It is a "friendly family" running the hotel only if everything is going smooth but they are most certainly NOT friendly when you question something - the man in the reception not only got rude he became downright abusive! in Italian of course - he cannot speak english. In fact communication is seriously a problem here, as no staff can understand you apart from one who has a very very basic knowledge of the language. My advice, even if it is cheaper (certainly was not for us) stay elsewhere around the similar location (Eastern or central rome). It is a B&B and not a 3 star hotel. My last interaction with the hotel owner/receptionist has really left a bad taste and memories of what is wonderful city and country.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: BristolJeanine
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the reviews of fellow Trip Advisors, and they didnt let us down, excellent location that you are in a central position to view all attractions, the rooms were very clean and towels changed daily. Breakfast was continental which was fine for us Brits, as " When in Rome Do as the Romans Do" THe air conditioning was not very cool but we opened the windows and it was fine until the binmen came at 1 am! The Vatican is amazing but what i would say that these companies that you pay to jump the queue are not worth it, if you dont mind queuing you will save yourself a fortune, as Rome is not cheap for drinking and eating so save it for what you want to spend it on. If you go to the Vatican museum go in the afternoon as there is no queues, dont pay to queue jump the Vatican as its free to get in so these are companies are conning you! Colesseum is not really worth going to as you can see anything inside as its all fenced off, see it for free outside, your not missing much. Trevi fountain is good but watch out for the no marks who steal the money out of the fountain. Very hot place in August so take your own bottle of water as there are plenty of places to fill up your bottle at springs around the City, this will save loads! try and eat in the back streets as they are cheaper and we got a taxi which costs a standard rate of 40 Euros which is a rip off! good place and you will need walking shoes as it is better to sample the City on foot as its easier to walk than get buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but uncomfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Walker201008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the end of May 2010. The hotel is at a very central location, within 10 minutes walk to Colosseum. But the room is very small. The shower place is tiny. I am a tiny person. But I could hardly turn myself when I am in the shower place. The bed is small and there are holes in the bed sheet. The breakfast is reasonable, but not exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, friendly family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: apprentice72
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Apollo in Rome, selecting a triple room to accommodate our teenage daughter. The room was clean and tastefully decorated with what appeared to be a recently refurbished en-suite shower room. The bedroom itself was not large but suited us as a base just to sleep and refresh ready to take in as much of central rome as possible. The shower room was large considering the size of the bedroom, well furnished and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was taken on the 5th floor with an outdoor terrace. The food is continental style with a good choice of fresh produce and we found it more than adequate to start the day. The hotel is only 10 mins walk from the colleseum, and very close to major bus routes and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: finny123
Reviews.Content: We booked the family room which is actually a suite (converted apartment in the building next door) and we were very surprised at the size and condition of the room. It was enormous (actually two rooms), with a big terrace (if you lean out far enough, you can see the colliseum), and nicely decorated. The owners were very friendly and breakfast was on rooftop terrace. I would definitely recommend this for families with kids but I guess you need to book early to get the family room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Apollo: great location, great breakfast, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ReneeSimiValley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apollo for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. The triple was nicely furnished, comfortable, very clean and quiet (We had a room in the back, away from the street). The pillows and beds were firm (but so were all the other beds in Italy). The towels were not terry as we were accustomed to, but were extremely clean and fine for drying after a shower.The personnel were very helpful and friendly. ( It is a family run hotel) The breakfast was delicious with meats, yogurt, cheeses, croissants, fruit, and cappuccinos made to order. The patio breakfast area was very pretty with plants and flowers.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tvh119
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Italy for two weeks, stayed at four different hotels - and this was my hands down favorite. I have nothing bad to say about it. The staff is friendly and amazing (family-owned and run), the breakfast on the roof-top is out of this world ... the room was clean and comfortable. Great location - easy to walk many places. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mntravel06
Reviews.Content: The location was near perfect for us, central to most things. We walked to everything except the Vatican. And the bus stop is only 2 blocks away. A few blocks from the colloseum. On a side street so not very noisy, and has excellent windows to keep sound out. Breakfast is adequate, similar to most other hotels. The price is reasonable for Rome given the location. Rooms are small. Shower was tiny. Our TV didn't work, but probably our fault for not asking them to fix it. We weren't in our room much anyways. Some of the front desk staff didn't speak much English, but they got by enough. Has internet at the hotel but very expensive. There's an internet cafe just down the road that's much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: batland
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our trip to Italy, and Hotel Apollo was the best hotel we stayed at in all of Italy. It was reasonably priced. We had room with the outdoor terrace. And this came in handy when we had to do laundry. If it wasn't so hot we would have enjoyed sitting out on it with our wine. The hotel is conveniently located to the train station, and the collosuem. We were able to walk to most sites without any trouble. In fact our in-laws rented an apartment near the Spanish Steps that was double the price, but noisey at night, and the air-conditioner only worked 1/2 power. We all agreed that our Hotel was much better. The staff was amazing. They called taxis for us, they gave us directions, and were always available to answer our questions. I can't tell you how much we enjoyed the beautiful breakfest they provided. I personally enjoyed the latte's what specail treat. We were in Rome durning 95 degree weather so it was nice to come back to a room that was nice and cool. We were able to control both rooms manually. The only two downfalls we had where. The towels are very thin, but useable. And because the location of our room, we had to go through two locked gates. If you didn't bring the key with you, you could get caught inbetween both gates, unable to get out. We found that out, because we have two very curious boys. I would highly recomed this location. The only two downfalls I have wi

Reviews.Title: “Only adequate; significant flaws; not a great value, even though price is moderate for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: MM7NY
Reviews.Content: This was a two-week vacation during which we visited Venice, Florence, Ravello (on the Amalfi Coast), and Rome. We paid almost exactly the same amount per night for each of the four hotels, and all were selected because they were pretty highly rated on TripAdvisor and appeared to be in convenient, central locations. Positives: 1. We were able to walk to the Apollo from the train station. 2. Breakfast was good, and the rooftop setting was nice, 3. The hotel was clean. 4. Our room was quiet, perhaps because I requested a quiet location and we faced the back rather than the street. Negatives: 1. Very low level of service. Although we do plenty of research before traveling, we also like to get suggestions from hotel staff about how to get around town, where to eat, etc. Furthermore, there are inevitably questions and problems which come up once you are in a foreign country, and at that point you are dependent on local input, which usually means the hotel. In this case, I had emailed the Apollo ahead of time with some questions; I usually didn't hear back, and if I wrote again, they would simply say "we'll help when you get here" (even when I asked about reservations for popular attractions which clearly require advance planning). All of the other hotels answered emails promptly, provided useful info, and were happy to make arrangements for us. Things didn't improve once we got to Rome: For our entire 4-day stay, the only person on duty all day was an older gentleman who barely spoke English and responded to all requests by saying either that he didn't understand or that we had to take care of it ourselves. Not only did this make things harder for us in Rome, but it was vastly different than the experiences we had with the other three hotels. 2. The room was small and dark. 3. The water pressure was VERY low, and the bath towels were embarrassingly bad - they were normal in size but were so thin that they could better be described as very large dinner napkins. 4. The location and neighborhood were OK but not great. The hotel is, indeed, close to the Colosseum and the Ancient Rome area. However, those attractions are not in the center of Rome, which means that the hotel is some distance from most of the other attractions and from many of the areas with good restaurants. You would be more centrally located, and in a nicer neighborhood, if you stayed either further west (oerhaps in the Piazza Navona area) or further north (at least in the Piazza Barberini area and perhaps above that). The Apollo was adequate, but I don't understand how it can be #38 of the 1287 hotels TripAdvisor lists for Rome (or even in the top 25%), and we would certainly try a different place the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: rapp1021
Reviews.Content: Room was adequate. TV worked only when it wanted to. Internet station in the hotel did not work. Towels felt like linen sheets. Street outside of main entrance can be very noisy outside at night. Only 1 person on duty at all times. Breakfast was very nice; it is on a 5th floor garden. Employees are polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy_TravelBrit
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this lovely family run hotel. The location is fabulous for ancient Rome, and you can also walk to all the central attractions. We found that the no 64 bus was great - ideal daytime travel to St Peters via Piazza Venezia, and also in the evening for Piazza Navona (a must place to visit in the the evening). Hotel nice and clean, breakfast buffet had an excellent choice of pastries, toast, juice etc. The drinks in the fridge in the room were reasonably priced and the owners were very helpful and friendly - they could not do enough for us when we were stranded due to the volcanic ash! Also hotel nice and quiet in the evening. Booked the forum and Colleseum with Presto tours before we went - excellent & I would recommend booking something beforehand - much better than the touts outside the Colleseum. Vatican, St Peters, etc. also a must. We alo went to Trastevere one evening and had a great time - so different from the other well known areas of Rome . If you have time, just slow down & enjoy the place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Migmad01
Reviews.Content: Good location and bedrooms where a very nice size. Breakfast on the roof was a good variety and tasty food. The only bad thing I can say is that the geaser broke and we were without cold water on our 3rd day, but that could happen to anybody. Always somebody available at reception to help.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: yu4ick
Reviews.Content: Apollo is great hotel in a fantastic location. Can see the Colosseum from the front door and is a short walk to it and other Roman sites. It is near via Nazionale and there are many eating places up and down the street. There is a self help laundry just down from the hotel. Hotel is staff are friendly and helpful. It is family owned and run and Massimo, son of the original owner, is very proud of his hotel. Nice breakfast served on the top floor. Room are clean and comfortable. Only issue is that we had a room that faced the street and it could get quite noisy. We sometimes had to close the windows and shutter them which made it kind of dark. But overall, the location, the facilities nearby, the wonderful staff make this a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBella46
Reviews.Content: The Apollo was spotlessly clean,comfy room, a family-run hotel with friendly reception staff 24 hours. Ample buffet breakfast up on the top floor, the sides must roll up in summer to make an open-air terrace. There are several good trattorias very near too. You can see the Colosseum from the door so great for that and the Forum, about 10 mins to metro station, tho the network is limited so walking will need to be done. Only small gripe was that our room at the front meant the noise of the public bins/bottle bank being emptied, which the council do in the middle of the night !

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - could be slightly cheaper”
Reviews.Author: Ribakit
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in the mid-February. The hotel is greatly located. The Coloseo is 10 min walking down the street. You actually see it from the hotel's doorsteps. The taxi stop is 5 min walking on Via Nazione. Rooms are fine, staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is passable but without any fried eggs or bacon. Try to take the phone number from their website and call directly to reserve - should be cheaper then online. Nice trattoria around the corner. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: elizabethWollongong
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in Dec. and had a great stay. the room was very clean a nd looked like it had been recently carpeted. The location is great you can walk to most major sites.2 minutes to the Colluseum. Quiet street with great places to buy fruit, cheese, wines, snacks etc. The breakfast was great with warm pastries, fruit, cereal, toast etc and the best fresh brewed coffee made on request. We made a habit of getting up quite early at least one morning in each destination to see the town /city wake up , this was especially rewarding in Rome. To be the only two people at the trevi fountain was something special. Do it ! There is a self serve laundry place on via cavour about halfway up heading to the main station which we found too late after paying top dollar using the the laundry service just down from the hotel ! also dont get a taxi to the hotel our guy took us the long way ,we got ripped off - either just walk down via cavour or via national. If you do use a taxi pay no more than 10 euro. The resturant in the middle of the plaza with the fountain just down from the hotel has great food and very cool feel. so good we went twice. We were in room 215 at the back of the hotel - was a bit dark but very very quiet. Like a lot of hotels in europe there are no No tea/ coffee making facilities in the room . Id recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: accidentallykle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Apollo Hotel for a 5-day anniversary holiday. The hotel is family-run, very well located (step out of the front door and you can see the Colosseum down the road!), and staff are friendly and helpful. It's a rather small hotel but rooms are a good, functional size and breakfast is generous. It's locately perfectly for a city holiday - close enough to the centre to pop back to if the weather turns on you and you need a sudden change of clothes!! And on top of everything, it's also very reasonably priced. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome - and you really should visit Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: iheartseptember
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the start of our honeymoon. It's a short hike from the train station -- walkable if you don't have too much luggage. The breakfast was very pleasant, with freshly baked croissants, a few cheeses, yogurts, and cereals, and a lovingly prepared cappuchino. Room was adequate, clean, quiet, and comfortable enough. Wi-fi available, $5 for 3 hours. The location really can't be beat, since we walked almost everywhere. You can see the Coliseum from the street (and even from your window if you lean far enough out).

Reviews.Title: “great location; great service”
Reviews.Author: Theresa5678
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very accommodating in provding info on how to get to sites. Colosseum down the street; Trevi within wlaking distance. Hotel is about 1 mile from train station, although mostly down hill;, recommend taxi if just arriving from outside italy

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly modern and beautiful family owned and run hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nesconsetbaseball
Reviews.Content: The Apollo was a nice surprise and a great value. We were not expecting such a nice hotel and didn't know the location was so perfect for what we wanted to do in Rome. A family owned and run hotel, the Apollo is beautifully decorated and centrally located right up the street from the coliseum. There are plenty of restaurants and bars close by. The rooms are a little small, as would be expected in Rome and breakfast was weak. The staff, mostly family members, are friendly and helpful. Consider this a strong recommendation to stay at the Apollo in Rome, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Heather-was-here
Reviews.Content: We returned today from a week long holiday, staying at the Hotel Apollo. We were given a triple room although we had only requested a double, so had extra space. The room was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet, although quite dark. The bed was very comfortable. Everything was very clean and the lift was modern. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast on the roof terrace was wonderful! There was fruit, cereals, breads, danish pastries, croissants, rolls, ham, cheeses, jams yogurts etc etc, and the rooftops of Rome to gaze at. The area had dozens of ristorante/pizzerias within a very short distance. We walked everywhere, except on our trip out of Rome, to Tivoli which I would recommend. Transfer to and from the airport at Fiumicino was 40 euros each way. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bronnwynne
Reviews.Content: After a cruise from Italy to Greece and back, my adult son and I wanted to spend a little time in Rome sightseeing. Since he's most interested in ancient Rome, I wanted to stay within walking distance of the coliseum and forum and other famous landmarks. When you step outside the Apollo, you can see the colsseum at the end of the street a few blocks away. There is an excellent restaurant around the corner (ask the owner--Tavertino something, less than a block away). The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are large and comfortable. Can't recommend this more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chilly550
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apollo in the end of July. What can I say?! Excellent hotel, friendly and helpful stuff, really good breakfast especially cakes and cappucino in a big cup. 7 minutes walk to Colloseum and 15 to Trevi Fountain. Nicely decorated spacious room with big bathroom. When I'm in Rome next time I would definetely stay in this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cozy, central location.”
Reviews.Author: wearybones
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Apollo, a brief break between two weeks of meetings in Europe. It was my first trip to Rome and I wanted something located close to the historic sights. Well- the Apollo is certainly close to everything! It is midway between the Trevi fountain and the Coliseum, a 7 minute stroll to either. My single room was quite small - see the photo that I've attached - but clean and quiet. It was all I really needed for sleeping. I had a chance to see a double room and it was quite spacious and looked very comfortable. I slept with the windows open and was not disturbed by street noise. The Apollo is located two blocks from any busy streets. The rooftop terrace is beautiful and the breakfast served there was great! The staff is friendly and helpful. Their advice on sightseeing and on restaurants is great. I would return to this hotel but I would not recommend it for business travellers or for families. It is a clean, quiet place to sleep, close to all of the things that you want to see in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Apollo!”
Reviews.Author: SaMMorris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apollo hotel for 3 nights and 4 days in the beginning of May. We got picked up from the airport and they made sure we were not overcharged. We also got there early and they let us leave our bags there till the room was ready and when we came back our bags were already waiting for us in the room. The staff were extremely friendly and very very helpful, they gave us suggestions for meals, and knew how to get everywhere we didnt easily. Their rooftop terrace for breakfast is beautiful, beds were comfortable and our bathroom was huge! The Colosseum is also literally down the block, you can see it from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel blocks from the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: nex2carwash
Reviews.Content: Wow - it's amazing to step out of the hotel & see the Colosseum every morning. Yyou must start your day on the 5th floor terrace and enjoy the best-stocked "breakfast-bar" we've experienced in Europe- a nice selection of meats, cheeses, fruits and juices - try the A-C-E, its very refreshing. Also, there is a fantastic selection of cappucino & other coffees available gratis. The rooms are modest by American standards, but are as clean and tidy as any great hotel in the US. Our room had a safe, but it was not listed online. A couple of oddities at this property include an unusual bidet-type aparatus that does not spray upwards, around the bowl, and more importantly bath towels that seem more like table cloths than actual towels (see photos). Most of the staff speaks BASIC English, but don't expect them to be able to give detailed suggestions. As for eating locally, we highly recommend Bottega Cafe, which is about 2 blocks toward the Colossem, behind the fountain - it's always busy and always good. Overall, a great place to stay - we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “walking distance central rome”
Reviews.Author: vista4u
Reviews.Content: location is apollo's best asset, it was a 5 min walk to the colliseum, 15 min to trevi fountain, 10 min to closest metro(the local A or B train cost is 1 euro, get ticket at machine), 15 min to termini station. small family run establishment is friendly, no real public areas except rooftop available breakfast only. my single room for over $100/nt was very small cell with a sagging mattress, when i booked the double for a few euro more was not available but a better size. did not like the recommended hotel/restaurant on via maggio and was overcharged. walk another 10 minutes to trevi and enjoy better quality and prices at "piccolo buco" on via del lavatore... great house red, wood oven pizza, handmade pasta...yum. enjoyed the pantheon, vatican(if you don't have tickets go early morning, colliseum, fountains, ruins, piazzas, and shopping. from fiumicino airport to termini train station rome is 11 euro on the leonardo da vinci train and efficient...if returning to the usa you will go from train to T5 signs by walking to curb pickup for small bus at "T5" sign, and be shuttled to T5 for luggage(bags are also weighed) and flight checkin, then security screening, after this you are shuttled to terminal for departure. although i was told to plan 3 hrs,surprisingly it took less than 1 hr to be processed and arrive at terminal for departure on continental (wednesday late morning april 1st); spent the extra time shopping duty free and a quick meal...but you can get a chair massage for a price!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate rooms but not a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: DelawarianFemale
Reviews.Content: Out of the four hotels we visited in Italy, the Apollo Hotel was our least favorite. It was the most expensive and the smallest. The owners have taken great care in furnishing and decorating the rooms, and despite it's small size (the rooms, the hallways, the elevator), it's very clean and polished. The room was dark (the one window let in very little natural light). The hotel appeared to be familly-run, and we also experienced the pushiness of the staff. You have to leave your room key at the front desk whenever you exit the hotel which required interaction with the staff. We found an amazing restaurant within a block of the hotel called La Carbonara. Although we showed up right at 7:00 pm when they opened, they only had one table left, so I would suggest making reservations. It was one of the many small quality restaurants in Italy where you can eat plenty for dinner (with wine) for less than $50 for two. And we never found a restaurant in Italy that wasn't perfectly happy to let us share a serving of food. The worst part about the Apollo Hotel was the location. Although it was fairly convenient to the metro (the best way to get around the city), the neighborhood seemed seedy and run-down. The streets were very crowded and many were under repair, and there seemed to be several local gatherings of men blocking the sidewalks. We also stayed in a hotel by the Barberini fountain and metro stop, and the location was very different. It felt quaint and friendly compared to this hotel. As for the walk to the Termini, it all depends on time of day. If you are walking there early in the morning, it is a breeze. If you are trying to get there in the late afternoon, you will have a much harder time trying to negotiate the sidewalks and getting across the ever-busy streets. I don't think you will regret staying in this hotel, but there are better ones out there. And although they provided computer access, you had to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: northamptonoldby
Reviews.Content: 5 of us in 2x2 plus 1 rooms. We were on 4th floor overlooking street. It's a fairly quiet street especially at night. Room was OK. Modern. A little small & dark perhaps, but clean. Breakfast was good quality continental on roof terrace (up a flight of stairs). Location good. Possible to walk to Termini (main station) with backp[ack but no more. Colisseum is about 600 m away. Could see it from window if I stuck my head out. Spanish steps etc rather further but within walking distance. Need to use underground or open top tour bus for Vatican. Main critcism is that there is a very small reception area and no real 'bar'. Just a room adjacent to reception. no pool or anything else..too city centre.. Staff were friendly and spoke enough English to get by. Proprietor recommended local restaurant run by grandson of Enrico Fermi with pictures of him around the wall..makes a change from footballers (look him up you physicians !) , v nice but a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good value”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2009
Reviews.Content: I chose his hotel based on location, as I only had one day in Rome and wanted to see the Colliseum, but in the end it was a very pleasant surprise. The hotel is very close to the main attractions and easy to get to using public transit. Just like the web site indicates it is 200m away from thr Colliseum, and therefore close to all the other sites. The room I stayed in was very clean, and comfy. The owners live there and the personal touch is present and obviuos everywhere in the building. Great service, great advice for scheduling and making the most of my short stay in Rome. The rooftop restaurant is awesome, I wish I would go back in the summer. Definitely a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: gallou
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rome a week. Location of this hotel is ideal. Far enough away from the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps that you don't feel that you are in the middle of the tourist area, yet still close enough to walk to all attractions. (You need to take a taxi, bus or Metro to Vatican and Villa Borghese, but that's all.) Rooms are clean, roof top breakfast is great. Massimo (owner's son) speaks very good english and was helpful with reservations for Galleria Borghese and restaurant suggestions. I would stay here again if traveling to Rome. Rooms facing the courtyard are a bit smaller but very quiet. Next time I might try a room facing the road for the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Floridians21
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! The rooms are clean and big. Location is great. The staff is very nice. We arrived at 7:30 am and our room was ready. We checked in and had breakfast (for free), which was great! Loved the cappuccinos. The gentleman in the reception gave us great touristic information. I would definitely go back to this hotel. I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short break”
Reviews.Author: sgstravels1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Apollo for four nights in October with two friends. We were all in the same room, which was a bit of a squash (no space to spread ourselves out), but as we were hardly in, it wasn't too much of a problem. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, the towels were changed every day, and breakfast on the terrace was a great way to start the day. The staff were friendly and helpful, although one was a little too pushy in trying to persuade us to book a taxi to the airport instead of getting the train from Termini. Other people have mentioned the great location - all the major sites of Rome are within walking distance, the Cavour metro station is five minutes away, and there are lots of buses on the Via Cavour and Via Nationale (the 40 goes all the way to the Vatican). There are loads of local restaurants too - the little square two blocks down has two great ones, both full of locals as well. Top tip - buy a Roma Card, which gives you free entry into your first two sites (including the Colliseum and Forum), and a discount thereafter, and includes a three day travel pass, which you can use on the metro, buses, trams and trains - excellent value for 20 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice - thanks to Trip Advisor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Paula083
Reviews.Content: What a great city - what a great hotel right in the middle of it all! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Apollo Hotel in September 2007 and we had a great time. We actually decided to stay at the Apollo due to the reviews on trip Advisor - a good choice this was. The best thing about this hotel is its location. You walk out of the hotel and tun left and there is the Colosseum at the end of the street. Generally you can explore most of the main sights in Rome on foot from the Apollo. The staff in the hotel were very helpful, this included general hospitality, recommendation of restaurants, calling for taxis and holding our suitcases on the last day as we had a late flight. The rooms were very clean as was the bathroom. Breakfast on the terrace is lovely - a very good start to the day and the breakfast is nice too! There is a good choice of restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. All of them were very reasonably priced (both food and drink) and the food was lovely. I would recommend staying close to the hotel for food and drink because closer to the general tourist attractions the prices shoot up and service doesn't seem to be as good. If you are wondering whether you should visit Rome then i'd say definitely go and if you do - stay at the Apollo.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: oakworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Apollo for 4 nights in September 08. Booked via expedia. Room was clean and tidy, bathroom very good with plenty of room. .Bed very comfortable Towels odd to start with but actually superb at drying yourself. Room cleaned to a high standard. Breakfast very good with a lovely 4th floor location. Pleasent staff all round. Good base to explore Rome. Good Argentine restaurant 400m down via serpenti then turn right on via Cavour then around 400m on right. Superb sangria !!!!!!!!! with music during meal. Would recommend the Apollo Hotel to anybody visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not such a big deal!”
Reviews.Author: vanta_8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becouse of the good rate that it has in the trip advisor but i think that it doesen't worth it ! Maybe our rooms where not as good as others . First of all the bathroom had a really small shower cabin , the presoure of the whater was not strong , there was a drop of urine on the wc the first day we arived (!) , there were no towels!!! i dont know how to call them kitchen towels maybe! and they were also torn and the last day dirty and 3 small(2 for the body they didn't have a big one). We stayed at the first floor and it was noise enought.We could hear the telephone ringing in the other rooms of the floor.People talking outside the room even the resepsionist downstairs. Also there was dust on the furniture and the three days that we stayed we had the same sheets which were also torn and never been ironed ! And the aircondition fan was old and dirty . The rooms where ok with new furnishing thanks God ! Also the personel was very friendly and polite ! The breakfast was ok but nothing special ! What can i say ? This hotel was nothing special !

Reviews.Title: “Great value & superb location”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: Nestled on a fairly quiet street leading up to the Colosseum, the Hotel Apollo is an ideal location for sightseeing in Rome. Its central location makes it easy to walk to most of the major spots, including the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and more. It’s a fairly basic no-frills hotel, but it’s comfortable and clean. We were in room 404 which doesn’t face via de Serpenti and was very quiet at night. My only complaint with our room was the bathroom. The shower was so, so teeny. It was nearly impossible to move at all while in it, and I’m a normal-size person! There wasn’t an exhaust fan, either, so it took forever to de-steam after showering. Also, the “towels” were a bit odd, in that they were extremely thin (like a dish towel, literally). The staff was pleasant. We got a lot of great tips on where to shop, where to go for nightlife and just answers to general questions from Alessandro, who is very helpful and there in the evenings. Complimentary breakfast was included in our rate and it’s served on a cozy shaded patio on the 5th floor. The selection was good (pastries, breads, meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal, etc.) and the cappuccinos were of course delicious. There’s also a small bar adjacent to reception, but unfortunately it was never open during our stay. It would’ve been nice for a casual drink after a long day of sightseeing. There’s also a computer with internet access in the bar area, and the rates are reasonable (I think 2€ or 3€ for an hour). The best part, though, was the location. There’s a cute little square just down the block with a few cafes/restaurants that we went to for a drink everyday after sightseeing. There’s also a fantastic restaurant in the square, Gli Angeletti, which we liked so much that we ate there twice during our stay. Definitely give it a try. There are also a few nearby delis and gelato shops in the area are plentiful! It’s also a cheap cab ride to Trastevere, a fun area with loads of restaurants right on the river. The Hotel Apollo served as a great base for us to explore Rome, and I’d certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect find”
Reviews.Author: slavezer0
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in august it is in a perfect position with the colloseum at the bottom of the road.It is a small and friendly hotel.Our room was quite small but really clean and the bathroom looked if they had recently being refurbished very very clean.The breakfast was lovely on the rooftop of the hotel with a choice of tables outside on the rooftop or inside it was really nice it had a great choice of rolls cheeses meats croissants fruit and jams and the coffee is made freshly it is gorgeous.The staff are really pleasant and very willing to help if you need any.We would definetly stay here again if we return to rome which hopefully we will has it is a fabulous city steeped in history

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apollo more than expected”
Reviews.Author: MshackW
Reviews.Content: We rented a junior suite at the Hotel Apollo in Rome, and were delighted with the accommodations. We had a private outdoor terrace, as well as a sitting room, and seperate bedroom. Our two teenagers slept in the sitting room, and were quite happy! The location was fantastic, the Colisieum was right down the street!!! In terms of price, the Hotel Apollo was moderate compared to others in the area. I do not know how the average rooms are, but I highly recommend the junior suite if traveling with two children or teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Apollo”
Reviews.Author: Lemster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights (May 2008) with my husband and college age daughter. Would definitely recommend and return to this small hotel. We stayed in the triple room facing the back. No view but quiet. The room was not huge but roomy enough. The bathroom with shower was nicely appointed and immaculate. Yes, their towels are like dish towels. Very thin, but large and absorbent. They were changed every day. No face towel, though,so bring your own if you use one. The upstairs breakfast room and deck were wonderful, as was the buffet breakfast. The buffet breakfast far surpassed the other three hotels we stayed in Italy on our trip. They served three types of juices, American coffee as well as freshly prepared cappuccino, rolls, warmed pastries, a variety of cheeses and meat spreads, cereals, yogurt, a variety of fruit from cans, and pound cake. Yum! As for location, it was very convenient to Via Nationale a major bus route (one block) and the Cavour Metro stop (walking distance of 2 blocks). And walking distance to the Coliseum/Forum and Trevi Fountain. The staff always made us feel welcome and communication was not a problem. As another reviewer pointed out the immediate neighborhood is quiet and not touristy. On the same block there are several very good small and reasonable restaurants (try the Due Colonne Ristorante/Pizzaria). Around the block on the next parallel street is a small well stocked grocery store. We also asked for a dinner recommendation from the staff and were very pleased with their recommendation. There is no internet access in the rooms; however they have a computer available to guests off the lobby. Also, there is an internet spot (with numerous computers) almost next door. On arrival we took a taxi from the airport. Make sure you agree on the set rate from the airport with the driver. There is a posted sign at the taxi stand. We left for Florence by train and took the metro to the station. Very easy even with rolling luggage. See my other reviews of Hotel Caravaggio, Florence and La Locandiera, Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great, little find”
Reviews.Author: Merrill13
