Reviews.Content: Hotel Apollo has a great location two blocks from the Colosseum. This is a small hotel with an elevator. The room was lovely and clean with a modern bathroom. Breakfast was typical. I meandered around the neighborhood and found, just two blocks away, a lovely small Piazza with a cafe and fountain. It is close enough to other attractions for a nice walk or the hotel will call a cab for you. There are a number of restaurants in the winding streets nearby and a great fish restaurant just two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Would Definitely Return!”
Reviews.Author: Clemsontiger1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my parents, stayed at the Apollo Hotel in April and had a great experience! We stayed in two seperate rooms, but both exceeded our expectations. The room my husband and I had was large with two windows overlooking the street below. The room was nicely decorated and included a wardrobe that housed a safe. The beds were very comfotable. The bathroom was small, but very clean. There were plenty of towels and the hairdryer worked well. The neighborhood was very pleasant and there were many local restaurants to choose from. The best one was a block or so down from our hotel (towards Via Nationale) near the Internet Cafe. I can't remember the name, but the walls were painted bright yellow inside. It was very quaint and the food was delicious and resonable. (Try the Walnut Gorganzola Ravioli!) Additionally, the Gellateria on our street (block or so towards the Colossieum) was wonderful. My husband and father would make repeat visits each day! The staff at the hotel was helpful. The assisted us in finding restaurants and getting a taxi a few times. No matter who we encountered, they always had a smile on their face and were ready to assist. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was also good. Each morning, there were a variety of coffees, juices and tea, along with fruit, pastries, breads, yogurt and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apollo all you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: sandijh
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Apollo, it was lovely, family run and they were all helpful. the room was clean and decent sized, the bath was nice, plenty of hot water, they do have weird towels though, more like a chamois. They had a great breakfast on the roof top garden area, continental with some hot items. The only problem was the air conditioning was broken when we were there, it was cool enough at night to sleep with the windows open and they said it would be fixed in a few weeks and I don't think it was throughout the hotel cause it seemed cool in the the lobby the location was great, ten minutes to the Colliseum on one direction and ten minutes to the Trevi Fountain in the other direction. we got lost but that's part of the charm of Roma and a nice police officer got us turned in the right direction. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndigoStar
Reviews.Content: My Husband, Brother and I just got back froma 5 day stay in Rome at the Apollo hotel. I just wanted to say this is a great hotel! So close to the Colloseum you can see it from the street but not in a touristy area. Close to restaurants and shops and lots of local stuff. We really had a great time. The service was amazing, the place was neat and clean. Really a no frills hotel, but that was fine with us. The only complaint was from my brother who is 6'3 190. The shower was a bit small for his size but most things are. :) So I guess that is not really a complaint. Anyway, I just want to say thank you to the staff that made us feel so welcome. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Smart little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BWBT
Reviews.Content: We spent just a single night at the Apollo and would certainly be happy to return. It is a smart and well run little hotel in a very good location. Just a few minutes walk from the Forum and the Colosseum, the area immediately around the hotel has a nice "neighbourhood" feel, surprisingly untouristy and stocked with a good range of bars and restaurants. Staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet good and rooms comfortable and well equipped. We had a room facing the street which was remarkably quiet overnight. Getting to and from Termini Station was quick and easy by bus or Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rgn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay.Great location ,within walking distance of all sites.Rooms small but very clean .Staff very helpful.We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jgb41
Reviews.Content: The Apollo is a very pleasant hotel. Our triple room was comfortable and the rooftop breakfast was a great feature. The best thing about the hotel, however, is the location. The Colosseum is down the block to the south, although it's still about a 10-minute walk. But it's also only a 10-minute walk to the north to the Trevi Fountain, To the west, a 10-minute walk to Piazza Venezia. To the east, 15-20 minutes to the Termini Station. In other words, classical, medieval and modern Rome are all in easy walking distance. We also liked the area the hotel is in. A lot of excellent and reasonably-priced restaurants, and it is not nearly as touristy as many other areas. It definitely has the feel of a real Roman neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: serie23
Reviews.Content: On Via dei Serpenti. Booked the hotel through Booking.com after having read many reviews. I think the hotel was a great deal. Right in the middle of attractions yet on a quiet street. What sold me on it was breakfast on the terrace and once there it lived up to it. Great Capuccinos prepared by Massimo. If you see him say hello from the couple from Virginia. Keep in mind this is a small family hotel. Service is limited and staff speaks little English. They were always helpfull as best they could and polite. Breakfast was plentifull with a combination of pastries, cheeses, ham, juices and excellent coffee. The airconditioning would not cool well at times but not enough to stop us sleeping. Our room was on the 3 floor and often we slept with the window opened in July and that was still comfortable (and we are used to ac). From this location we walked everywhere, even Piazza del Poppolo (we're 45 and 50 yrs old). We didn't need public transport. There is a very good Pizzeria, can't remember the name on the same street as you exit to the left of the hotel, but on the right side of the street. Good gelato near the Pizzeria too. To be fair, we only dealt with Paolo, his wife and Massimo. There was a male clerk at night but I didn't feel comfortable enough with him (thought he might have some kind of deal with cab). I would definitely recommend the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “close to the best attractions in old Rome”
Reviews.Author: tintinwannabe
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews have pointed out, you can see the Colosseum from the room. Walking distance to Trevi fountain and the Pantheon. Clean room with a large bathroom and a friendly staff. We would stay here again. Nearby restaurants just a few doors down, and the price was reasonable for our two nights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy!”
Reviews.Author: MessyCat
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Hotel Apollo on our way back from Sicily to the UK. It was our first time in Rome, so we'd had no idea where to stay! The hotel was a pleasant surpise,entering off a fairly nondescript street,into a bright, fresh and friendly hotel. A warm welcome from the prorietor, and then shown to our room by his wife. The room, though not large, was adequate and clean. The bathroom was excellent. There was a small minibar with prices that were very reasonable, we thought. We only had time for breakfast on the first morning, but we presume it's always the same - a good continental buffet selection. We found it conveniently situated for sightseeing - only a short walk to the Metro, and obviously only a short walk to the Coliseum! Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Oasis in midst of Chaotic Rome”
Reviews.Author: quercus_magnus
Reviews.Content: Great location to access sites via foot, transit, this hotel is family owned and operated, and it shows. Great location in a moderately busy neighborhood. Convenient walking access everywhere, good restaurants in neighborhood. Breakfast on the roof top terrace started each day perfectly. Coffee drinks were wonderful. The family-run operation really shines through. Friendly, very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations, arranging transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location for Colloseum and Forum”
Reviews.Author: LMA1
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Spotlessly clean and recently renovated. Friendly staff who went out of their way to help us with maps, directions and restaurant recommendations. Lots of nearby cafes and bars with no traffic noise. The hotel is in a great spot to see the Colloseum and the Forum ruins. I should say that it was a bit of a hike to the other sights like the Spanish Steps and the piazzas but we walked it anyway. I highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely be staying there again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMATraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Italy and spent 3 nights of our trip in Rome at the Apollo Hotel. First, it was easy to find! A relatively short walk from the Termini station (which is where the train stops from the airport), or an even shorter walk from the Cavour stop (which requires switching trains at Termini and going one additional stop). Also, we had a view of the Colosseum from our room, the staff was super friendly and helpful, the rooms were exactly as promised, it was a quiet location, and the breakfast on the roof was wonderful (better cappuccinos that at our other hotels in Italy!). I would definitely recommend this for people wanting to sight-see around the city. Its a relatively short walk to most major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: TravelKatOC
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I stayed at in Rome. Very conveniently located, near the Colosseum. The room was clean, with a lovely marble-accented, spotlessly clean bathroom (usually the mark of a good hotel, in my opinion, is how clean their bathrooms are). The staff were friendly and helpful, and promptly called for a cab to the train station on the day of my departure from Rome. All in all, a great stay! Would definitely book a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delfos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on august. Hotel is in a great location allowing you to walk to all the main attractions, about 500 mt. from Coloseum. Good breakfast being served on the roof terrace. Friendly staff (the owners). Rooms very clean and tidy. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve33Oxford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights back in October last year. Hotel is in a great location allowing you to walk to all the main attractions and explore, rather than having to rely on public transport. Breakfast of pastries, fruit and cereals etc being served on the roof terrace is a great way to start the day and there are plenty of restaurants near by. Really good friendly staff, very clean and tidy. Can't rate the Apollo enough, will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had a 5 day mini break at the hotel in April, the Hotel chosen primarily based on the location, reviews and the cost. We were very pleasantly satisfied with the hotel as previous reviewers have already stated that this is a very clean and well managed hotel. The breakfast is the standard continental fare with plenty for everybody, the rooftop breakfast garden being particularly delightful. This hotel is located in a working neighbourhood with mini local supermarkets and bakers and some fantastic Italian Ice cream and coffee shops nearby, be warned even with all the walking you may gain a few pounds!. In all we never felt uncomfortable walking around late at night. The Cavour Metro stop is nearby and the Hotel is perfectly situated if you are considering seeing this great city using the local transport or by foot. The front desk (owners?) where particularly helpful when requesting information about nearby tourist locations, The Vatican and trevi fountain to name two, saving us money on more than one occasion by suggesting and directing us to take local transport to the tourist sites. The Colosseum is a gentle 15 minute walk (Hotel to Colosseum ticket office) and I would suggest that you take a tour to get the most of your time there. A lot has been written about the various tour groups that take you around the Colosseum, Angel tours beating the queues etc but I did not really see any evidence of this as all the tour groups had to join an equally long tour queue to get in. We did the Official Colosseum tour (go to the left past the tour groups queue) and buy your tickets from the ticket booth which where 50% cheaper than other unofficial tour group prices. You get a one hour guided tour with a very knowledgeable tour guide and the option to spend as much time in the Colosseum as you want, the ticket also covered the price of entrance into the Parthenon which is close by. Enjoy this great city. Tip If you get the chance and the weather take the Metro to the seaside, it's only a half hour metro ride away and makes for a great break from the city.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jksHouston
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Apollo. The family that operates the hotel is delightful, patient and very helpful! Good, quiet location in the hustle-bustle of Rome. Breakfast on the terrace was very peaceful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snresq
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I spent a night at the Apollo in April 2007. We booked it from reviews we had read in tripadvisor.com. We were not disappointed. The room and bathroom were clean; the rooftop breakfast garden was quite charming; the staff was very helpful; the cappucino was great! The Apollo is on a quiet street which runs right into the Colosseum. There are restaurants galore in the neighborhood. Plus, there are a lot of nice shops hidden down side streets, so just take your time and walk around. One very nice touch: we were only in Rome for two days and one night. We got to the hotel at about 10:30 am, which is early for check in, but they were ready for us. Further, because we wanted to tour the city the next day before leaving for Florence by train, the owner of the hotel allowed us to keep our luggage behind the desk the whole day before picking it up on our way to the train station. All in all, a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: LadyDar
Reviews.Content: Having received confirmation from the booking service for three rooms for our family of four, we arrived to find only ONE room available. At 10 PM at night, we were on the streets of Rome trying to find a Hotel that had 3 rooms available. The staff simply said there was some 'confusion' about our stay and they tried to get 3 of us to stay in a three bed room in a dirty hotel down the block. We cancelled the following 3 days of booked reservations as we considered this non service as they made no attempt to find us a Hotel anywhere in Rome for 3 rooms. Thank you American Express for finding us another Hotel and sneding a Taxi to rescue us after midnight on the streets of Rome.!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Areyougonnaeatthat?
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a fabulous stay at the Hotel Apollo. The hotel overall is quite small, as all hotels in Rome appear to be, but our room was a very reasonable size and both it, and the bathroom (which I am very picky about!) were spotless. I must say though, that the shower was a bit on the small side. We had a lovely view from the window (if you poked your head out and looked left!) of the Collosseum. Unfortuately the owners didn't speak much English, but the staff had a much better grasp of it, and everyone was very friendly. The rooftop terrace where breakfast was served was lovely, and there was a good mixture of continental offerings i.e. bread rolls, cheese, ham, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, pastries etc (what you would expect from a European hotel). The only thing my boyfriend and I were a little disappointed about was the fact that it was a little too quiet for us in the surrounding area. There were lots of little cafes, and restaurants down the side streets, but no nightlife at all, so if you are looking for a lively area, do not stay here! Overall though it was a perfect break, and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be faulted - Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carginman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. A small family run hotel (26 bedrooms I think) in the most central location you can imagine. Our room was very large, along with a large and spotless bathroom. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was top quality and a perfect way to start the day. Staff were very welcoming and while they didnt speak much english, there was never any problems. The room was very comfortable thanks to the well controlled air-con. In terms of location, its hard to imagine any better. A 5 min walk along the via Nationale from the metro stop meant that any city location was at most 10 mins away! A dozen doors up the street and we found a lovely restaurant and a dozen doors down the street a large ice cream parlour! It cost us just 105 euro a night, and for the quality of the stay they could easily charge double. A first class hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dianella
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome in August and stayed at the Apollo for 4 nights. The location is great, you can see the Coliseum from the hotel street. Our room was very small and dark but very clean, although I have to say our sheets were not changed ones during our entiere stay. The bathroom was spotless clean but the shower extremely small. You can't hardly move when you are in it. The breakfast was great and having it at the roof terraze makes was something special. The owners are very gentle and staff helpful. My husband got sik during our stay and we had to find a doctor. Paolo, the owner, called their family doctor right away and got us an appointment. We would definitly go back but I have the feeling that you could perhaps find some better deals in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with very friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: suattulek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Apoolo for 7 nights with my family (Me, my father and my mother). Actually, this hotel is great. First of all it's in the center of Rome. You can go anywhere at anytime you want, and you can comeback easily even with walking (We barely used buses). When you look down on window you can see the great Colosseum at the end of the street. The rooms are big ad comfortable and have good bathrooms (Which they clean daily). The second thing is the staff is greast. They dont know English that much but they're really friendly and helpful people. They made our trip even more joyful. So, thanks to all of them. And the last thing is, all days they have a great breakfast in the roof deck. It is a lovely decorated place with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all you could ask for. Walking distance to all major attractions, clean , friendly. Breakfast on the roof top was a delightful way to start each day. Don't think i could have enjoyed my hoilday more !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSueSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Apollo for 2 nights last month and would definitely recommend it. The owners (husband and wife) were very charming and helpful. They don't speak much English, but we communicated just fine. The rooms aren't very large, but decorated nicely. The window opened up into a pretty courtyard. The bathrooms are very nice, and extremely clean. The air conditioner worked really well, and after a long day of walking, it's nice to come back to a cool room. The buffet breakfast on the rooftop garden was really good, especially the pastries that tasted very fresh. Excellent coffee and cappuccino! The hotel is located near many restaurants and shops and close to the Colossuem and Trevi Fountain. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for couples, not families with infants”
Reviews.Author: JKaczor
Reviews.Content: I I stayed in this hotel in late April with my mother and 7 mo. old son. This is a family run three star hotel. The hotel is centrally located (between colisseum and trevi fountain) and has been recently renovated. They also have a wonderful rooftop terrace where a very nice breakfast is served. The family and hotel staff are extremely nice, though none speak English well. Most who stayed in the hotel seemed to be Italians on vacation. After booking the hotel through an online booking site, I called both the booking site and the hotel directly to confirm that they would have a crib for my son. Despite assurances otherwise, upon arrival, I found that the hotel had no cribs. To their credit, the owners offered us a single room for my mother for a reduced rate, so that I could sleep with my baby in the full size bed in the double room. They definitely went out of their way to make the situation right. I most definitely recommend this hotel for singles, couples or families with older children, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff.. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our holiday in Italy and we were delighted with the standard of accommodation at Hotel Apollo in Rome. The room was tastefully furnished and the bathroom looked recently renovated. The staff were very helpful and the location was ideal. At times we called back to the hotel to change into something cooler or use the bathroom before moving on to the next "must see" sight of busy Rome. We enjoyed their buffet breakfast upstairs and appreciated the close but not too close proximity to the train station. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting value for money and clean, comfortable, recently renovated accommodation close to all the action of the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring central Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of hotels in Rome on business and was prepared for something fairly basic given the central location and relatively good value for money (EUR 180 per double room per night). The Apollo was a very pleasant surprise. The location is truly central, in sight of the Colosseum and just behind the Bank of Italy. We spent 3 days exploring Rome from the Colosseum to the Spanish Steps and from the Trastevere to the Via Veneto all on foot. The hotel is nicely decorated with a small reception area and good recently re-fitted rooms and en-suites. We had front facing rooms and with windows open for air at night you do get an idea of the sleepless nature of city life - not unpleasant just there... Breakfast is taken up on the roof with enclosed and open areas. The buffet is very good with proper coffee (of course) and fruit, cereals, pastries, bread rolls etc. Staff were friendly and very helpful and our lack of Italian was not a problem. I certainly plan to stay here again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Apollo through Venere and paid 130 Euro per night for a double room. The staff were very friendly and helpfull, the rooms were of a good standard and very clean. The bathrooms were spacious and spotlessly clean with shower, toilet, sink and bidet. Like all the other reviews we have read regarding this hotel, the breakfasts were very good with all manner of breads, croisants, cheeses bread, fruit and cereals and very good cappucino. Again like the other reviews the bathroom towels were very thin, but they dried you OK. The best way I can describe it was like getting dried with a table cloth. The hotel is ideally situated for all the tourist attractions. The Colloseum is about 10 minutes walk and likewise to the forum, Pantheon, Spanish Stps and Trevi Fountain. The Vatican is around a 40 minute walk, but we queued for one and a half hours to get into the Cistene Chappel, best to get there early. Best advice, get a good map. There are many restaurants in the area all of a similar sort of price. We paid around 20 Euro a head for 2 courses with a bottle of wine. Forget about driving, it would be horendous just to try and park. Rome is not very pedestrian friendly and you have to be careful crossing roads even on a crossing as most motorists especially motorcycles still keep coming even when you have a green light to cross. All in all enjoyed the visit and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: poojones
Reviews.Content: This was a small hotel, with small rooms but it was great for what it was. Fantastic location literally down the street from the Colloseum. We walked everywhere we needed to go in Rome. Excellent headquarters. The staff was pleasant, specially the older gentleman at the front desk. The breakfast buffet was surprisingly abundant and tasty. The minibar was very reasonably price considering the cost of soda everywhere else. Not much of a view though. They also turned the air-conditioning off at night. Great value though.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: naladoodle
Reviews.Content: This is a small family run hotel which is perfectly situated right up the road from the Colluseam. We only stayed here one night (our last night in Italy). The beds were the most comfortable we found in our 2 weeks in Italy. The hotel was clean and the rooms were small and efficient. Massimo referred us to a fab restaurant around the corner called Le Tavernelle. One of the best meals and certainly a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apollo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Super hotel! The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were a 'just right' size, very clean and well maintained each day. Breakfast on the top floor each morning was plentiful and always looked fresh and very well presented. Yes - the towels are meant to be thin - you'll get over it! Location was close to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon,etc... and of course Colloseum is just down the road - literally. Great ice cream shop just down the street as well - yummy! I woudl thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay there again for sure - I will be telling all my friends and family to book in there. Enjoy Rome and Hotel Apollo

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel - perfectly situated for all the sights and easy access from the train station. To be able to see the Coliseum when you step out of the hotel is amazing! The rooms are a good size, comfortable and very clean. Breakfast on the roof terrace is delightful and not to be missed. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: neiltubby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel apollo for three nights in april with my wife. It is ideally located for all major tourist sites, and I could see the colloseum at the end of the street (via de serpenti) from my hotel window. We had a lovely breakfast on the hotel roof terrace each morning, and the room was nice, clean and quiet. We were provided with fresh towels (very thin) each day and the room and bathroom was cleaned each day also. It is expensive, however I think all hotel rooms in Rome are expensive, so compared to other hotels of a similar price I am sure we found one of the better ones. The local area is full of cafes, pizzerias and little shops, there is also a great ice cream place 50 metres from the hotel. I would definitely stay at the hotel again, if only for the view of the colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saintsfan_7
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value tourist hotel, in a central area, then consider this hotel. Just got back in the week the Pope died. Hadn't planned to be there then, just happened to be there. Hotel didn't try to put prices up as other hotels tried to according to other tourists I met. Good breakfast. The thin towels other reviewers mentioned aren't worn out, they are just that type of towel. Colluseum can be seen from bedroom window. It is about 30 minutes steady walk from the Termini Station, along Via Cavour. Watch out for pirate taxis if you arrive by bus from the airport late at night. Ignore anyone saying they are a taxi, real ones have the sign on top. Go round the corner to the front of the station. Should be about 10 Euros.

HotelInfo.Name: Apollo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dei Serpenti 109, 00184 Rome, Italy
